title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor, attempting to open the same file in another editor by right-clicking and selecting 'Open With... System Editor' does not trigger any action or display any error message.
EB: The workbench should display a warning message stating that opening the file in another editor may result in overwriting any unsaved changes, and offer the option to continue with the operation or cancel it. Alternatively, an error message should be shown indicating that all files must be closed before opening the file in another editor.
SR:
1. Close any open files in the workbench.
2. Switch to the Java Perspective.
3. Double click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the same Java file and select 'Open With... System Editor'.
5. Observe that no action is taken and no error message is displayed.
